title: 5 Times K-Pop Fandoms Donated In The Name Of Their Groups ‚Äî Koreaboo
text:
5 Times K-Pop Fandoms Donated In The Name Of Their Groups Published: 2 hours ago 
K-pop fans are known to be very dedicated to their groups and express it as often as possible by helping out with different worthy causes as a fandom. 
Over the years, K-pop fandoms have done huge amounts of humanitarian work in the name of their favorite groups, fighting the stigma behind their fandoms and doing their part for the world while supporting their groups at the same time. 
Here are 5 times K-pop fandoms donated in the name of their groups! 1. Seo Taiji and Boys 
Seo Taiji and Boys , a 90s trio that are often considered one of the founding fathers of K-pop, had their 20th debut anniversary in 2012. In honor of that, Taiji Mania, the group‚Äôs fan club, raised almost $35,000 to donate to the World Land Trust. All of the money went into making the ‚ÄúSeotaiji Forest‚Äù, a 5-hectare section in Brazil‚Äôs Gaupi Assu rainforest. Seo Taiji later donated himself, forming the ‚ÄúSeo Taiji Mania Forest‚Äù, which is located right next to the forest his fans made earlier. Seotaiji Forest on Google Maps 2. Shinhwa 
Prior to 2007, fans usually would have flowers and banners arranged at concerts. However, during Shin Hyesung ‚Äòs solo concert, fans sent hundreds of kilograms of rice for charity. After this, fans from all different K-pop fandoms started donating rice in honor of their groups. Fans have also donated 1,130 trees to Seoul City Park to mark Shinhwa‚Äôs 15th anniversary. Rice donation made by Shinhwa fans in honor of their 15th anniversary. / Source: SFSubs 3. 2NE1 
In 2012, fans of the girl group 2NE1 also decided to donate trees, donating 1,210 mango trees to the village of Troj. This provided food and shade to all the villagers of the town. This donation was made to celebrate 2NE1‚Äôs ‚ÄòNew Evolution‚Äô Seoul Concert. Children from Troj with a banner for 2NE1. / Source: YGLadies 4. B.A.P 
On January 19, Singaporean fans of the boy group B.A.P raised a total of $1,400 which was used to buy 1 ton of rice and given to low-income families in Singapore. A member of the local fan club Protect B.A.P Singapore stated that they were motivated by B.A.P leader Bang Yongguk , who is known for his humanitarian efforts and encourages people to help the elderly and those in need. Poster made by Protect B.A.P SG for their Project R.I.C.E Fundraiser. / Source: Protect BAP SG Certificate of Appreciation issued for B.A.P. 5. Super Junior 
The official fan club for Super Junior , E.L.F, donated 110 kilograms of rice and 1,106 packages of ramen to the Salvation Army in honor of the 11th anniversary of Super Junior‚Äôs debut. A post shared by Brunei ELF üáßüá≥ (@bruneielf) on Nov 5, 2016 at 11:04am PDT Facebook Conversations
